description: a(n) = number of m such that sum of proper divisors of m (A001065(m)) is n.
comments: The offset is 2 since there are infinitely many numbers (all the primes) for which A001065 = 1.The graph of this sequence, shifted by 1, looks similar to that of A061358, which counts Goldbach partitions of n. - _T. D. Noe_, Dec 05 2008
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=2..10000
example: E.g. if n=6 then a(6) = 2 since s(25)=6, s(6)=6.
maple: with(numtheory): for n from 2 to 150 do count := 0: for m from 1 to n^2 do if sigma(m) - m = n then count := count+1 fi: od: printf(`%d,`,count): od:
author: _Naohiro Nomoto_
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Feb 19 2001
